constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: AIRCZ Type:: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

description: Discharge of conditions 3 (Details of Materials), 4 (Cycle Parking Facilities), 5 (Refuse Storage and Recycling Facilities), 9 (CO2 emissions and water usage) and 11 (Sound Transmission Reduction Measures) of Planning Permission 18/14527/FUL (Demolition of existing building. Erection of a two-storey building with accommodation in the roofspace for use as a commercial unit and 7 flats).
decision_conditions: The details submitted for Condition 3 (Details of Materials), 4 (Cycle Parking Facilities), 5 (Refuse Storage and Recycling Facilities), 9 (CO2 emissions and water usage) and 11 (Sound Transmission Reduction Measures) of planning permission  18/14527/FUL by the applicant are considered satisfactory and these conditions are hereby fully discharged.

The development approved by this planning permission will be liable to pay the Mayor of London's Community Infrastructure Levy (MCIL).  Payment will be due once the owner/developer serves a development Commencement Notice on the Council, and a payment Demand Notice has been received by the owner.  Failure to submit a Commencement Notice will incur a surcharge of 20% of the chargeable amount or Â£2,500, whichever is the lower amount.   When you have discharged all pre-commencement conditions the Council will issue a Liability Notice to the owner setting out the MCIL calculation.  Accompanying the Liability Notice will be a  blank Commencement Notice and if necessary a blank Assumption of Liability form, both of which need to be completed and returned to the Council prior to development commencing.  A failure to do so will incur a surcharge.  Should you have any questions in respect of the contents of this letter or the MCIL more generally, please contact the Council's Contact Centre by email mcil@rbk.kingston.gov.uk <mailto:mcil@rbk.kingston.gov.uk> or phone 0208 547 5002.

Application form says non-illuminated. Description says non-illuminated, however the plans show two large lights above the sign.Please confirm which it is.  If it is non-illuminated then you will need to amend the plans. If it is  illuminated then the description of works would have to be amended. (please confirm).

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise with information provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Acceptable minor repeat works with no adverse impact upon tree health or public amenity.Recommendation:No objections.
